Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the increase in Medicaid spending by stating that it will go up by 20 percent over the next 10 years.
Lack enough support: The expert's verdict mentions that Gingrich did not provide enough support or evidence for his claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in Medicaid spending is a result of the House health care bill, without considering other factors that may contribute to the growth of the program.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict suggests that the increase in Medicaid spending mentioned in the claim may be a result of the program's natural growth over time, regardless of the health care bill.
